newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish Korona to launch mass privatisation fund.
newsitem.headline: Polish Korona to launch mass privatisation fund.

text.p: Polish mutual fund company TFP Korona will launch a mass privatisation fund, investing in National Investment Funds shares and NFI units of Poland's privatisation scheme, Korona's president said.

David Glasgow told a news conference the new fund, which will start operating before the National Investment Funds enter the Warsaw bourse on June 12, will also invest in shares of companies approved for public trade and held by the funds.

"It is likely that many investors...will find it very difficult to know how to proceed (in the programme) so our reason for lauching the fund is to act as an intermediary between the first stage of the programme...and the events of the second stage," he said.
Under Poland's mass privatisations scheme shares in about 500 mid-sized companies are allocated in 15 NFIs, which are scheduled to start bourse trade on June 12.
About 26 million Poles have bought a participation unit in the scheme, which are currently traded on the bourse and since from May 12 they have been being exchanged for shares in the NFIs.
